resources.name: them. But putting my meds next to the kettle? That works. We ADHD brains are object permanence-challenged. If we don’t see it, it doesn’t exist. Try this: Move your most forgotten task into your line of sight. Put it in your walking path. Tape it to your laptop if you have to. 5. Pick your “launch pad” This one saved me from the daily panic of missing essentials. I now have a “launch pad” by the front door: keys, wallet, work bag, meds, umbrella. It’s all there, waiting like a faithful golden retriever. Try this: Create a launch pad. Use a basket, shelf, or even a shoebox. Put your everyday essentials there. Non-negotiable. 6. Name your bins like a weirdo I used to shove things in random boxes. Out of sight, out of mind…until I needed them. Now, I give bins funny, obvious names. One says “Cables & Crap.” Another is “Stuff I Pretend I’ll Return.” It makes me smile —
